content.question: When monochromatic light of frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is incident on a metal with intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> electrons are ejected with maximum kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which change would cause electrons to be ejected with a maximum kinetic energy greater than <math alttext="K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.

choices.label: Increasing the frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> while keeping the intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> the same
Decreasing frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> while keeping the intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> the same

Increasing the intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> while keeping the frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> the same

Decreasing the intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> while keeping the frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> the same

content.answer: Increasing the frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> while keeping the intensity <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> the same

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
